contextId.information: Peter asks this question to emphasize that there is nothing praiseworthy about suffering for doing something wrong. AT: "For there is no credit ... while being punished" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
contextId.quote: For how much credit is there ... while being punished?

contextId.information: Peter asks this question to emphasize that it is unlikely that someone would harm them if they do good things. AT: "No one will harm you if you do good things" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
contextId.quote: Who is the one who will harm you if you desire what is good?

contextId.information: Peter use this question to emphasize that God's judgment will be more severe for people who reject the gospel than for believers. AT: "If it begins with us, the outcome for those who do not obey God's gospel will be much worse." (See [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
contextId.quote: If it begins with us, what will be the outcome for those who do not obey God's gospel?
